text: Jack Senior (born 18 July 1988) is an English professional golfer who plays on the European Tour. He has won twice on the Challenge Tour. ==Amateur career== Senior won the Egyptian Amateur in 2010 and the Lytham Trophy in 2011 among others. He played on the winning Great Britain & Ireland team in the 2011 Walker Cup and turned professional shortly after. ==Professional career== Senior has played on the Alps Tour and the PGA EuroPro Tour. He won twice on the Alps Tour in 2012 and twice on the PGA EuroPro Tour in 2014. Since 2012 Senior has played primarily on the Challenge Tour. He won his first Challenge Tour event in 2015 at the SSE Scottish Hydro Challenge. He beat Robert Coles and Prom Meesawat with a birdie at the fourth hole of a sudden-death playoff. He won for the second time on the tour at the 2019 ISPS Handa World Invitational beating Matthew Baldwin at the second hole of the playoff. He was also runner-up in the Lalla Aïcha Challenge Tour and finished the 2019 season 6th in the Challenge Tour Order of Merit to earn a place on the 2020 European Tour. His home club in the U.K. is Fleetwood, in Lancashire. ==Amateur wins== *2010 South of England Amateur, Egyptian Amateur Open *2011 New South Wales Matchplay, Lytham Trophy, Hampshire Hog Sources: ==Professional wins (6)== ===Challenge Tour wins (2)=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No. !Date !Tournament !Winning score !Margin of victory !Runner(s)-up |- |align=center|1 |align=right|28 Jun 2015 |SSE Scottish Hydro Challenge |−16 (66-69-66-67=268) |Playoff | Robert Coles, Prom Meesawat |- |align=center|2 |align=right|18 Aug 2019 |ISPS Handa World Invitational |−11 (68-68-66-67=269) |Playoff | Matthew Baldwin |} Challenge Tour playoff record (2–0) {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No.!!Year!!Tournament!!Opponent(s)!!Result |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=center|1 |2015 |SSE Scottish Hydro Challenge | Robert Coles, Prom Meesawat |Won with birdie on fourth extra hole |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=center|2 |2019 |ISPS Handa World Invitational | Matthew Baldwin |Won with birdie on second extra hole |} ===PGA EuroPro Tour wins (2)=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No. !Date !Tournament !Winning score !Margin of victory !Runner(s)-up |- |align=center|1 |align=right|1 May 2014 |Eagle Orchid Scottish Masters |−5 (71-66=137) |Playoff | James Frazer, Elliot Saltman |- |align=center|2 |align=right|31 May 2014 |Kerry London Championship |−9 (68-68-71=207) |1 stroke | Sam Connor |} ===Alps Tour wins (2)=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No. !Date !Tournament !Winning score !Margin of victory !Runner-up |- |align=center|1 |align=right|12 May 2012 |Servizitalia Lignano Open |−11 (68-68-69=205) |Playoff | Jesús Legarrea Barberena |- |align=center|2 |align=right|3 Jun 2012 |Open de St Francois Guadeloupe |−21 (65-68-64-66=263) |10 strokes | Thomas Fournier |} ==Results in major championships== {| cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" border="1" style="font- size: 95%;
